questions.question: We still don’t know ………………………. Mars supports life or not.
questions.description: We use the conjunction whether to introduce an indirect yes/no question.

questions.question: Scientists …………………………… that Mars might have supported life in the past.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about people’s beliefs, fears etc.

questions.question: Characteristics like channels on the Martian surface indicates that the planet …………………………….. once very wet.
questions.description: We use the simple past to talk about a past situation.

questions.question: Scientists are …………………………… to learn about the history of water on Mars.
questions.description: Here eager is used as the complement of a verb of incomplete predication. Adverbs cannot be used like this.

questions.question: Water is fundamental to the question of whether the planet has ever ……………………….. microbial or some other life.
questions.description: We make perfect tenses by putting the past participle form of the verb after has or have.

questions.question: Life …………………………… we know it requires water.
questions.description: We use as before a clause.

questions.question: A fisherman once ……………………………… on the banks of a river.
questions.description: The simple past is common in storytelling.

questions.question: He ……………………………….. fishing every morning, but could never catch enough fish.
questions.description: Both the simple past and would + infinitive can be used to talk about past habits.

questions.question: He ………………………………. a miserable life.
questions.description: Led is the past tense of lead.

questions.question: Then one day he ………………………………… a big fish.
The fisherman ………………………………. the fish to the market, but no one could pay the price he demanded.
